TopicTitle: What aerodynamic model do you use?

Articles.Content:
What aerodynamic model do you use?

I use NEAR most of the time, and use Squad's sloppydynamics sometimes.
FAR. NEAR is just like FAR, except with less features. Stock doesn't cut it for me, though if I'm launching rockets designed for it, I might use it.
Psh, you don't USE the stock aerodynamics. They use YOU.

Psh, you don't USE the stock aerodynamics. They use YOU.

Lol. I play stock, simply because they are balanced with the tiny size of the planet and my rocket launch delta-v values would all be borked if I changed it.

Also rather tellingly I rarely use planes.
I use FAR. I enjoy the advantages it gives to sleek craft which I like building. Also, the surface control failures add an extra challenge to aircraft design which I appreciate.
I use FAR 100% of the time. I get a lot of satisfaction from a successful plane as it becomes fairly challenging.

Stock mostly, though when launching rockets (Especially while climbing the career mode tree) I really do prefer FAR because it feels more like an accomplishment.

I play in Stock mostly due to my YouTube channel. I'm trying to appeal to the broadest audience so want to play in stock Aero at least most of the time.
I just can't go back to the stock "aerodynamics" after trying the glory of FAR.

FAR + KIDS. First mods installed

The stock aero is horrible.
I've been using FAR for ages. Once you get the hang of it, launches cost far less fuel to get into orbit than the stock aerodynamic model.
FAR for 6.4 Kerbin (since I only do rockets) and stock for nornal gameplay. I don't like stock aerodynamics, but for some reason all of my FAR designs end up flying like pigs.
Giving a poll option a derogatory name skews the poll.

I used to use FAR, but I got a bit frustrated when the structural failures were introduced... (I'm a pretty sloppy pilot, and not really THAT hardcore...)

But NEAR has been working great!

I finally made a spaceplane last night!
FAR always. You can just turn the aero failures off... then you get NEAR + useful supersonic effects ( re-entry with subsonic drag, that sounds horrible ) + actual tools to help build craft with.
Sloppydynamics ^.^

Other; the one in stock all the time. I do not recognise the term 'sloppydynamics', although the mindset behind it is obvious.

There are three reasons why I don't use FAR;

1) Memory issues prevent me using any but the most essential mods (to me) - I'm not in atmosphere enough to care much about it.

2) FAR isn't stock and whatever stock changes to is what I'll have to aim tutorials at - another aerodynamic model would just add confusion.

3) I only use the most essential mods because of issues with memory - Now I realise that technically speaking that's the same as '1' but I thought that it was such a big one that it was worth mentioning twice.*

[* and the first person to spot the reference is *psyper*]

Edited November 29, 2014 by Pecan

I use the stock aerodynamics because I share my craft often and I assume most of the people who download them do not have modified games. I could have 2 copies of KSP with one running FAR and make a FAR version of my crafts, but that would take too much work, so my crafts remain using stock aerodynamics for simplicity.

Giving a poll option a derogatory name skews the poll.

This is correct, the OP needs to change the description. It's implying he's making a loaded question and pre-emptively making degrading remarks about people who do use stock. Elitism at its finest.

Edited November 29, 2014 by Levelord

So far, about half the entrants have said they use FAR or NEAR. And a lot of the comments say "I use stock because I cant count on people using mods"

It sounds like there is an overwelmong demand for Stock FAR/NEAR

FAR now. But I have done most of my play in stock.

Also, no option for Stock Drag Fix?

I'm amused given the mod denigration/hate around here that people are considering modders elitists

FAR's license is GPL, so I'm not sure that's compatible with building it into stock. Possibly a bit detailed for the overall aims of stock anyway.

Now I realise that technically speaking that's the same as '1' but I thought that it was such a big one that it was worth mentioning twice.

Knew what it was from but had to google the quote

Well done that man!

I knew what I wanted to say but had to google it to make sure I got it right :-)
Brickodynamics because I'm lazy about these things. Remind me to install FAR and pFairings when 0.90 comes out.

FAR, been using FAR since day 1 of my KSP time, FAR+DRE. And your poll is a bit biased.

I love FAR only because I love planes more than rockets and it is easier for me to test out aircraft builds and get a more realistic result in FAR then I would out of stock.
Stock. If Stock changes, then I'll change. I'd rather learn from Oldstock to Newstock than unlearn from FAR to Newstock.
